Africa, Fiji and Australia make up last-four lineupThere haven’t been many rugby sevens matches quite like the quarter-final between France and Argentina, haven’t, in all honesty, been many Olympic moments quite like it either. France won it 26-14, their last, match-winning, try, a spectacular solo tap-and-go scored by (who else but?) Antoine Dupont. But it wasn’t the action that made the occasion, good as it was, but the atmosphere around it. There - [Paula Radcliffe defends child rapist's inclusion in Olympics](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/paula-radcliffe-defends-child-rapists-inclusion-in-olympics/view/)BBC pundit Paula Radcliffe, who later apologised, told British radio station LBC that she wishedNetherlands beach volleyball player Steven van de Velde the "best of luck". - [Aussies end rugby sevens curse by qualifying for medal rounds; Follow live. - [NRLW season kicks off with thriller as contenders suffer heartbreaking near-miss](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/nrlw-season-kicks-off-with-thriller-as-contenders-suffer-heartbreaking-near-miss/view/)The Newcastle Knights have kicked off their premiership defence in style after weathering a hungry Roosters outfit in the NRLW season opener. - [Olympics dreams shattered in just 42 minutes before opening ceremony](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/olympics-dreams-shattered-in-just-42-minutes-before-opening-ceremony/view/)Australia has helped shatter the dreams of 12 athletes more than 24 hours before the Paris Olympics Opening Ceremony even begins on Saturday morning (AEST). - [Aussies ruled out of Paris Games in brutal blow; big sevens chance arrives: Olympics LIVE](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/aussies-ruled-out-of-paris-games-in-brutal-blow-big-sevens-chance-arrives-olympics-live/view/)The Opals have been dealt a frustrating setback on the eve of the Paris Olympics with Bec Allen ruled out of the Games due to injury. - [‘That was awesome’: Dylan Cease pitches second no-hitter in Padres history](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/that-was-awesome-dylan-cease-pitches-second-no-hitter-in-padres-history/view/)Pitcher struck out nine in 3-0 win over NationalsCease fell one out short of no-hitter two years agoDylan Cease overpowered the Washington Nationals for nine innings, pitching the second no-hitter in San Diego Padres history in a 3-0 win on Thursday that completed a three-game sweep. After falling one out short of a no-hitter two years ago when he gave up a single to current teammate Luis Arráez, Cease retired Ildemaro Vargas and Jacob Young on a groundouts for the first two outs of the n - [How a pair of Tasmanians could achieve sporting immortality at the Paris Olympics](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/how-a-pair-of-tasmanians-could-achieve-sporting-immortality-at-the-paris-olympics/view/) [via](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/how-a-pair-of-tasmanians-could-achieve-sporting-immortality-at-the-paris-olympics/) [abc.net.au](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-07-26/tasmanians-competing-at-the-paris-olympics/104141600)With Ariarne Titmus, Eddie Ockenden, Max Giuliani and Jack McVeigh to name just a few of its stars, Tasmania has a reason to dream big at the Olympic Games in Paris. - [Unbeaten Aussies qualify for sevens knockouts after stunning upset: Olympics LIVE](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/unbeaten-aussies-qualify-for-sevens-knockouts-after-stunning-upset-olympics-live/view/)Australia has secured a huge upset over reigning world series champions Argentina in the men’s rugby sevens, the Aussies winning 22-14 to secure a perfect 3-0 record and top Group B. - [Matildas slump to heavy defeat in Olympic opener as Germany show class](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/matildas-slump-to-heavy-defeat-in-olympic-opener-as-germany-show-class/view/)World No 4 side begin Group B campaign with dominant 3-0 victoryAustralian frailties exposed by 2016 gold medallists in MarseilleThere was a moment midway through the second half of the Matildas’ Olympic opener that epitomised what was ultimately a listless, uncomposed performance, punctuated occasionally by moments of quality. Captain Steph Catley and Caitlin Foord combined in a flash of brilliance on the left flank to unlock the German midfield. Catley found herself released, striving fo - [Matildas handed brutal reality check in Olympics opener against heavyweights Germany](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/matildas-handed-brutal-reality-check-in-olympics-opener-against-heavyweights-germany/view/)The Matildas have suffered a brutal reality check in their bid for a first-ever Olympics medal, slumping to a 3-0 defeat to heavyweights Germany in the opening match of their Olympics campaign. - [Two weeks to save the Games – can Paris 2024 restore the dream factory? | Barney Ronay](https://www.newslocker.com/en-au/sport/sport-news-australia/two-weeks-to-save-the-games-can-paris-2024-restore-the-dream-factory-barney-ronay/view/)On Friday the Olympics swing into full action, but can the spectacle still drown the detail, cost, greed and waste?“We need to re-enthuse.” This was probably the closest Emmanuel Macron came to a tearful cri de cœur during his latest address on the eve of France’s Olympic Games. It is a reasonable enough statement in itself, although one that might be more accurate with the removal of the “re” part.
